Line 43: Line 43:
*In the [[1980s]] and [[1990s | 1990s]], necrophilia emerged in the [[Heavy metal music|heavy metal]] sub-genres of [[death metal]], [[black metal]] and [[goregrind]].
*In the [[1980s]] and [[1990s | 1990s]], necrophilia emerged in the [[Heavy metal music|heavy metal]] sub-genres of [[death metal]], [[black metal]] and [[goregrind]].
*In [[1993]], a [[music video]] for [[Tom Petty]]'s hit song "[[Mary Jane's Last Dance]]" featured the singer simulating various romantic poses with a dead woman (played by [[Kim Basinger]]).
*In [[1993]], a [[music video]] for [[Tom Petty]]'s hit song "[[Mary Jane's Last Dance]]" featured the singer simulating various romantic poses with a dead woman (played by [[Kim Basinger]]).
  +
*In the 1994 film [[Clerks]], a girl mistakenly has sex with a dead man in a convenience store bathroom.
*In [[2000 in music|2000]] [[Comedian]] [[Stephen Lynch (comedian)|Stephen Lynch]] released a song called ''A Month Dead'' about a necrophiliac who's lover is beginning to smell on his only studio album to date entitled ''[[A Little Bit Special]].''
*In [[2000 in music|2000]] [[Comedian]] [[Stephen Lynch (comedian)|Stephen Lynch]] released a song called ''A Month Dead'' about a necrophiliac who's lover is beginning to smell on his only studio album to date entitled ''[[A Little Bit Special]].''
*In [[2003]] the Colorado based humor-horror punk band [[Crackula]] recorded a song entitled "NecroFeelin'" about a necrophilic love affair.
*In [[2003]] the Colorado based humor-horror punk band [[Crackula]] recorded a song entitled "NecroFeelin'" about a necrophilic love affair.
